abstracts.cdata!:
The Fiscal Federalism & Regional
            Fiscal Reform Project had a satisfactory outcome, likely
            sustainability, substantial institutional development
            impact, and satisfactory performances by both Bank and
            Borrower.  There are four main lessons from this operation:
            1. The competitive model of promoting reform can be
            effective. 2. Technical assistance is more effective when it
            is reinforced by an incentive framework. 3. Ownership
            matters. 4. Subnational fiscal reform can be a legitimate
            topic for policy lending.
